hackathon-description-text: People working in legal services from all over Florida will come together for three days to envision what a more coordinated & effective network of legal services could be in the state. They will tackle one of of five challenge areas, define a specific opportunity within it, and design a new initiative to address this challenge.
hackathon-requirements: All entrants should include the following seven things with their submission:
hackathon-rules: Rules established in person at the Summit.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The winning team members will receive an all-expense paid trip to the ABA Equal Justice Conference:
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: All-expense paid trip to ABA Equal Justice Conference

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion:
The need, benefits and opportunity are clear, compelling and believable.

The solution is described completely, concisely and is easy to understand

The solution seems feasible and viable.

The solution will positively affect clients, communities, advocates, partners and/or the system.

The team's goals, if achieved, will make a large and positive long-term difference. 

The solution is a viable and attractive investment opportunity

The team has developed a truly innovative and defensible solution to an existing or emerging problem.

The solution scales across geography, size or type of program, vulnerable population or is replicable in other programs or other areas.

- Is clear, concise, confident, professional and stayed within the 8 min time frame.

- Is creative, energetic and delivers a memorable message.

- Is compelling, easy to understand, and focused around a clearly articulated need

hackathon-description-header: Creating new initaitives to promote a more coordinated & effective network of legal services in Florida
